feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Migration Cockpit: Exclude data from sub structures
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Using the migration cockpit to export customers, we have the requirement to exclude certain information like dunning data (KNB5).
1. Can the BAdI CNV_OR_OBT_PRESEL_BADI be used for this?
When I tried the BAdI CNV_OR_OBT_PRESEL_BADI, it appears that when data is deleted from table KNB5, it causes the entire customer to be excluded - which we don't want.
2. Is it possible to use the "Skip Rule" function to exclude data from sub structures (like KNB5) without removing the entire overlying entry it belongs to?

Best Regards,
Victor

entry.title: Upload Template for Business Partner Counterparty Role and Facility
entry.content:
We are currently looking for upload templates for the following data objects:


  • Business Partner Counterparty Role
  • Facility

We tried searching for these templates using the "Migrate Your Data" Fiori app but were unable to find any standard upload templates related to the above items.


We would like to confirm the following:


  2. Are there standard upload templates provided by SAP for Business Partner Counterparty Role and Facility?

  4. If none are available in the standard, what is the recommended approach to upload or migrate data for these?

Looking forward to your guidance.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

*Note To SAP:
I give approval for SAP Support to use these Steps to Reproduce, while connected to my impacted non-production environments, even if the steps result in a change being made and my approval remains valid until the issue is resolved, unless I inform SAP Support otherwise.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Multiple Counter Performance-Based Maintenance Plan Migration
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a requirement to create a multiple-counter performance-based maintenance plan in S/4HANA.

  • While checking the LTMC / Migration Cockpit templates, I could not find a specific template that supports multiple counters with AND/OR logic.

  • Is there any standard template available for this scenario?

  • If not, can this be achieved via LSMW or by enhancing the object in LTMOM?

  • In case it is not currently supported in migration cockpit templates, does SAP have any plan/timeline to deliver this functionality?

Any guidance or feedback will be highly appreciated.

Regards,

Sriram

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud Public Data Migration Plan
entry.content:
Dear expert community, I hope you can shed some light on this topic,

The 3SL roadmap viewer for S/4Hana Cloud Public edition does not provide an clear guidance on data migration planning that includes suggestion of:

- migration cockpit items (master records, dependent master records, transactional records) dependency and sequence
- migration cockpit items relationship to best practices scope items (example, scope item J45)
- planning space to assign owners, dates of preparation, dates of execution on test an production

Roadmap viewer for 3SL provides a word document called DM approach and Strategy which provides generalities only.

Does SAP offer std accelerator or official documentation that helps partners building accelerator like this? is the team at SAP that owns the maintenance of roadmap viewer considering adding this in the near future?

I recall other SAP methodologies (like the cloud launch) that offered this accelerator (see attached the screenshot DM Plan Sample).

entry.title: Data Migration Cockpit reporting data already migrated
entry.content:
Data Migration Cockpit issue with multiple cycles of the same object failing with DMC reporting data already migrated.

Following scenario:
Using DMC with staging tables (using own tool to stage the data, not file upload).
You are doing a Master Data migration, Business Partner, Create Scenario.
You stage a data set and add a key for the tables, let's say BP_0001.
You migrated the entry successfully but found errors. 
You truncate the staged data and insert the data again (with some corrections or additions).  There is no problem doing that as the earlier key was removed - so the entries were NOT adjusted.

Now trying to re-run the same ("new") data which would create a new BP.
The DMC remembers somehow that the key was migrated and does not allow it. 
Questions:

  1. Does the migration need to be reset?
  2. Should the deletion be only done from DMC and not the 3rd party staging tool? When deleting all instances in DMC it might clean out more consistently that previous migrated information and keys?
  3. Any additional table where DMC stores those already migrated keys? If so why and where?

Other comments are suggestions?
Above scenario gets more complex for extending master data but those are in my view typical use cases in project migration cycles.

Thanks for answers, helps and ideas in advance.

entry.title: SLT ISSUE IN S4HANA MIGRATION
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We have a scenario where our ECC system is being migrated to S/4HANA. In the current setup, data from ECC is replicated to a HANA database using SLT.

Post-migration, the SLT source system will be updated to S/4HANA. We have more than 800 tables being replicated from ECC to HANA today, and after migration, we need to continue replicating these tables (wherever they still exist and are not obsolete in S/4HANA).

Has anyone worked on a similar scenario and can share:

Cutover / data load strategy for such a large volume of tables

Challenges faced during replication from S/4HANA, especially regarding:

Data type mismatches between source and target

Additional fields appearing in S/4 tables

Handling obsolete or replaced tables

 

Any insights, lessons learned, or best practices would be really helpful.

Thanks in advance!

entry.content:

Thanks.

entry.title: Questions regarding Business Partner Migration via Migration Cockpit in SAP Public Cloud（ID:F3473）
entry.content:
Hi,

I am attempting to migrate Business Partner (BP) master data using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Migration Cockpit（ID:F3473）.

I understand that the key fields are "Customer Code" and "BP Grouping." However, I would like to know if it's possible to use a BP Grouping other than the standard ones.

I believe the standard groupings are as follows:
BP01
BP02
BP03
BPAB
CPDA
CPDN
CPDS

When I try to perform the migration using a BP Grouping that I created in addition to these, I receive the following error message:
"Assignment of BP grouping XXXX to customer account group is not possible" (Message Class: CNV_DMC_SIN, Message No.: 587)

Is there any specific setting that needs to be configured to resolve the cause of this error?

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Workflows Migration.
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I'm looking for a guide, conversion objects matrix, or documentation on migrating workflows from an on-premise system to S/4 HANA. Keeping in mind that the target system only allows user access through SAP Fiori, I'm considering that.
That is, if a step in my workflow calls a transaction, what should I look for? A Fiori app if it's standard, or a Fiori development if it's a client transaction (z).
If a workflow step calls a classic SAP Fiori app, what should I do? Create a Fiori app?
How can i find this recomendations?

Thank you very much and best regards.
Dsanchez.

entry.title: ODN Official Document Numbering fields in Migration Cockpit templates
entry.content:
Hi

I have configured and tested ODN field, following blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-store-long-suppli...

It is working fine.

How can we migrate those values from the old system during open item migration? AP migration will include open invoices that should be complete, with long invoice number. AR invoices should be migrated with e-document number that is also stored in ODN field, as per standard system configuration. As far as I checked, the migration template does not include that fields, even when ODN field is configured in the system. 

What should be done to migrate the values of ODN fields as part of AP/AR open items migration?

BR

Małgorzata

entry.title: Enabling Multiple Instances (Bulk) processing on a custom Migration Object
entry.content:
Hi,

I have created a custom Migration Object in txn LTMOM (using the Staging Tables approach) and selected the "Process Multiple Instances at Once" checkbox for my object.  Looking at standard templates with this enabled, I can see that the input tables contain a field called SENDER_TECHNICAL_ID (data element FS4MIG_SENDER_TECHNICAL_ID) and the return table also has a special type (table type FS4MIG_T_BAPIRET2) which also contains this field.  So far, so good!

I have looked at the code in "Includes for Handling the Result Parameter" of standard bulk-enabled templates and they share some common processing, particularly the use of standard include DMC_PLV_OLO_BULK.  Following these examples, I have written my own include for my object which also has DMC_PLV_OLO_BULK included at the end.

The problem comes when I try to generate my object.  I get the error message:
FORM "_RULE_IS_S4H_CLOUD_P" does not exist.
Further investigation shows that this subroutine is called from the standard DMC_PLV_OLO_BULK include.

Looking at the function groups that have been generated for objects from standard templates, I can see that this subroutine, along with many others, can be found in the ...FI4 include (named "IL - RULE CODE").  Although a ...FI4 include appears in the function group generated from my custom object, it does not contain any of the subroutines that are called from the standard DMC_PLV_OLO_BULK include.  I have compared the set up of my custom object with some of the standard objects but I can't find any setting or code that would lead to these additional subroutines being put in the ...FI4 include.

Does anyone know what triggers these standard subroutines being included in the generated function group?  Has anyone managed to bulk-enable a custom migration object using  the common includes found in the standard objects?

Many thanks in advance,

Andrew

entry.title: Clarification on “Manage Memo Record 2.0” and Bank Account Opening Balance Behavior
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

According to the SAP Help Portal, the “FI – Bank Account Balance (Deprecated)” template has been deprecated, and SAP now recommends using the “Manage Memo Record 2.0” app to import the initial bank account balance.

Ref : FI - Bank account balance (deprecated) | SAP Help Portal

I have tried entering the bank accoount balance using the Manage Memo Record 2.0 app.
After the upload, the amount correctly appears in the Cash Flow Analyzer app for the respective bank account, which indicates the memo record is recognized by the system.

However, when I subsequently created the first bank statement in the system, the amount entered via Manage Memo Record 2.0 does not appear as the opening balance for that bank account in the statement.

Could anyone please clarify:

  1. Why the amount recorded via Manage Memo Record 2.0 is not reflected as the opening balance in the first bank statement?

Thank you very much for your guidance and support.

entry.title: Migration Cockpit Material BOM Item ID control field ITM_IDENT_EXT issue
entry.content:
Experts, need help with S4 Hana 2023/08 Migration Cockpit (MC) loading the Material BOM.  In the download Template there is a field on the BOM Item called "Item ID".  This is a mandatory field, but we want the system to generate the Item ID number and not have to enter in one for every BOM item we have.

From the information on the internet, the control field ITM_IDENT_EXT field needs to contain a 'X' for the system to generate this field during conversion.  It is supposed to be located on the MC Template for the Material BOM in the BOM Item section.  But this field does not exist.

We reviewed the information for the MC Project in the LTMOM transaction and could not find this ITM_IDENT_EXT field anywhere.  If we try to leave the "Item ID" field on the template blank, we get an error during the MC Upload.

Does anyone know where this ITM_IDENT_EXT field exist or how to force  the MC to automatically generate the "Item ID" field during conversion?

Any help would be appreciated.
